intro: Galium tunetanum, commonly known as Tunisian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often hairy, while its fruits are small, dry capsules. Galium tunetanum is generally not cultivated but can be found in natural habitats across its native range.
